There have been a number of big changes in M6, particularly the move to osgi-
based runtime, so .config is no longer valid between M5 and M6.
Remove it, and then run eclipse again.
You can probably reuse the workspace, but if you see any problems with just 
keeping the workspace (no .config) then please open a bug on Platform Core.

What is the purpose of .config?

Where is the whole set of settings of the IDE I had to configure manually
(beside projects specific settings)?

Will ./.config ever contain any user config instead of just system config, if it
is the case, so that we will be expected to migrate this folder too, to a new
unzippped location?

What is the expected eclipse update routine, if not by copying those folders and
starting the new unzipped location?

.config is used by the update manager and by the osgi runtime to cache bundle 
data, info about features/plugins that are installed, etc.
This directory should not contains user preference settings, those are 
currently stored elsewhere.
In general, it is expected that the .config is not migrated by the user and it 
just gets removed before unzipping a new driver.
When migrating to a newer build, you should only reuse the workspace.
